title: thunderbird setup
content: I am unable to set up Thunderbird to use bellsouth.net email. I get username, password, or configuration no good, or something like that, which is basically no help at all. I enter username, email address, and password. It's all good until I press DONE, at which point it "checks password" until the no go message comes up. Win11, new Dell desktop. I can't fix this. If you can, please tell me how. Thanks -- Paul.
creator: dps1943

title: Thunderbird Email Presentation Problem after updating.
content:
After updating to latest Thunderbird, when I display a received message, the "From:" address has my email account and not who it is from; along with a YELLOW Notation band at the bottom of the message that says "A unique identity matching the from address was not found. The message will be sent using the current From field and settings from identity John Kirkpatrick <jpkirkpatrick@earthlink.net...." The email message is then displayed in what appears to be an email missing the Remote Detail. Why is this being done and how can I just get my Normal Email Display back? </p>

Going through every setting I found the hot-keys "CTRL=O" will open the message in a new tab with the normal Remote Information like it used to do before updating. How can I get that to be the default display of the emails in their list table? Thanks in advance for any assistance you can provide. John Kirkpatrick [ jpkirkpatrick@earthlink.net ]
creator: JPKirkpatrick
